history.content: CS 61C + CS 168 will definitely be a lighter workload than CS 170 + CS 186. When I took CS 168 (Fall 2017), the course only had 3 homeworks (basically projects), 1 midterm, and 1 final. CS 168 homeworks/projects were slightly easier than CS 186 homeworks/projects. Exams were pretty fair as well in my opinion, but since there is only 1 midterm it did cover a lot of topics.

children.subject: While I've never taken those classes concurrently, I've taken each of them separately. CS 168 and CS 188 are the lightest workload upper division courses (not saying anything about concept or exam difficulty, just only time). Definitely a manageable schedule if you have a good group (not required for the course, but helps) to work on CS 61C projects/homeworks with. If not, perhaps you want to lower your workload for the recruiting season in the Fall in hopes of having more time for studying for interviews as well.
just out of curiosity, what is the point of taking 3 techs, especially when you've taken two this semester? It seems like you're getting very, very far ahead

I wouldn't say that taking 3 techs is "very, very far ahead," considering that I know people who have been taking 4/5 techs a semester. Granted, these are exceptional cases, but nonetheless I would say 3 techs is actually fairly common.
Thanks! For anyone who's taken 188 as well as those 2 classes, do you think that taking 61C+168+188 together would be overkill for someone who's never done 3 techs?

history.content: I'm an L&S CS sophomore currently taking 170 and 186. These are the only 2 CS upper divs I've taken so far. How is the combo of 61C + 168? How is the difficulty of that combo compared to that of 170+186? Is the difficulty of 168 similar to that of 186?
history.subject: CS 61C + 168
